meanings.definition: Not equivalent in value or meaning.
meanings.sent1: The two paintings were nonequivalents in terms of style and color.
meanings.sent2: The nonequivalents sizes of the shoes made it hard to find a pair that fit perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The nonequivalents opinions of the students led to a lively debate in class.
meanings.sent4: Her nonequivalents talents in painting and singing made her a unique artist.
meanings.sent5: The nonequivalents flavors of the ice cream left everyone wanting to try a different one.

meanings.definition: Things that are not equal or interchangeable.
meanings.sent1: In the box, there were nonequivalents of socks, none matching the other.
meanings.sent2: The nonequivalents in the set of keys made it difficult to unlock the door.
meanings.sent3: The nonequivalents in the group made it hard to form a balanced team.
meanings.sent4: The nonequivalents in the collection of stamps were all unique and rare.
meanings.sent5: She sorted the nonequivalents of buttons into different jars based on their colors.
